WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for logging this issue. We've moved to a new codebase on GitHub; please try your issue against the new compiler (once possible) and log an issue on the GitHub site if it still reproduces.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi,

In Visual Studio, under certain circumstances, when a TypeScript file is copied from one project to another, the build action also changes to something other than "TypeScriptCompile".

To reproduce
`
1. Open up the attached solution, which should contain three projects.
2. Drag and drop file "Script.ts" from project B to A.
3. Right-click on A/Script.ts, view properties and the build action should correctly display "TypeScriptCompile".
4. Drag and drop "Script.ts" from B to C.
5. In my case C/Script.ts now has build action "CodeAnalysisDictionary".
6. Drag and drop "Promise.ts" from C to B.
7. In my case B/Promise.ts has build action "Fakes".
WorkItem.Summary: Inter-project file copy changes build action

Comments.Message: Thanks for reporting, we're taking a look.
